chapter.title: Installation

abstract.para: The base installation of Jobsworth 4.0 is very easy (big improvement to previous releases), once a server with some SQL-database and a servlet container has been set up. For those of you not setting up such servers frequently, I have added some more screenshots and commands, that might help you speeding up the installation process.

note.para: The following installation instructions are based on FreeBSD® 9.2. Other Unix-like operating systems may also work, once a LAMP server has been set up. Especially pathes to configuration files differ in various distributions from FreeBSD® and have to be adapted individually.

chapter.para: First of all get an operating system on a dedicated machine running. Typically Jobsworth only uses server functionality, therefore a graphical user interface (e.g. Gnome or KDE) is not necessary. If you are new to server installation, such GUI would help you to find your way around (e.g. looking on the web for HowTo's).

section.title: Database
section.para: Install the database-server package. You can either use mysql or postgresql. The following example shows the setup of mysql . After invoking mysql from the command-line you should see a screen like this:
section.screen:
$ mysql Welcome to the MySQL monitor. Commands end with ; or \g. Your MySQL connection id is 6 Server version: 5.5.33 Source distribution
Copyright (c) 2000, 2013, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rigths reserved. Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates. Other names may be trademarks of their respective owners.
Type 'help;' or '\h' for help. Type '\c' to clear current input statement.
mysql>

important.para: If you see any minus-signs in the screenshot above: This is some unresolved rendering error problem (for PDFs only?). Be aware that those minus-signs shall NOT be typed as part of the configuration scripts that will follow.

section.para: Now type in the following commands to create the jobsworth database and an admin-user. Feel free to adjust database-name, user-id and password and note it for later configuration. Then quit mysql-console.

screen.userinput: CREATE DATABASE mydb DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'monty'@'localhost' WITH GRANT OPTION

note.para: At a later stage in this installation process Jobsworth will setup all tables and initial data on its first call.
